column3: It also seems to make no sense, as you already use gui->message() anyway, why should we add a connect for message() here? I'm so much confused, need a break.\n
@laanwj I upated the pull with your recent suggestion and moved `handlePaymentRequest()` main functionality back to BitcoinGUI. Perhaps you can take another look.\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/2384a2864b6a0b29eec6410057aefe1fd8e7e585 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
Shouldn't this be gui->gotoSendCoinsPage(), to make sure that the right "tab" button is set as well?\n
[snip]\nNo longer valid after merge of new receive workflow\n
Will you fix them or shall I do this via this pr?\n
If you want to fix it in this PR that'd be easier, otherwise we'll create conflicting pulls, and it's only a two-line change.\n
I've got a brain-blocker I guess, this should be gui->gotoSendCoinsPage()->walletFrame->gotoSendCoinsPage()->WalletView::gotoSendCoinsPage()... im afraid, this seems still too complex ^^.\n
AFAIK this could also be a gui->showNormalIfMinimized(), which would remove a signal/connect in here?\n
Personally I prefer the signal; I'd like to get rid of propagating the direct gui reference downward some day, but the priority for now is to get this fixed.\n
